00145 /* Turn off free run mode if processor doesn't support it */
00146 #if !defined(ADC_FREERUN)
00147 #undef ADC_FREERUN_MODE
00148 #define ADC_FREERUN_MODE 0
00149 #endif
00150 
00151 /* Sleep control register used by ATMega*8 MCUs */
00152 #if defined(SMCR)
00153 #define  SLEEP_REG                  SMCR
00154 #else
00155 #define  SLEEP_REG                  MCUCR
00156 #endif
00157 
00158 // Determine clock settings from the given kHz clock rate */
00159 #if ADC_DYNAMIC_CLOCK == 0
00160 
00161 #define ADC_CLOCK_REAL (ADC_CLOCK_KHZ*1000L)
00162 
00163 #if   F_CPU/2 < ((ADC_CLOCK_REAL*13)/10)
00164 #define ADC_PRESCALER   1
00165 #elif F_CPU/4 < ((ADC_CLOCK_REAL*13)/10)
00166 #define ADC_PRESCALER   2
00167 #elif F_CPU/8 < ((ADC_CLOCK_REAL*13)/10)
00168 #define ADC_PRESCALER   3
00169 #elif F_CPU/16 < ((ADC_CLOCK_REAL*13)/10)
00170 #define ADC_PRESCALER   4
00171 #elif F_CPU/32 < ((ADC_CLOCK_REAL*13)/10)
00172 #define ADC_PRESCALER   5
00173 #elif F_CPU/64 < ((ADC_CLOCK_REAL*13)/10)
00174 #define ADC_PRESCALER   6
00175 #else
00176 #define ADC_PRESCALER   7
00177 #endif
00178 
00179 #endif

00181 /* REGISTER NAME FORMING */
00182 #ifndef CONCAT1
00183 #define CONCAT1(a, b) CONCAT2(a, b)
00184 #endif
00185 
00186 #ifndef CONCAT2
00187 #define CONCAT2(a, b) a ## b
00188 #endif
00189 
00190 #define ADC_PORT_OUT_REG       CONCAT1(PORT, ADC_PORT)
00191 #define ADC_PORT_DDR_REG       CONCAT1(DDR, ADC_PORT)
00192 #define ADC_PORT_PIN_REG       CONCAT1(PIN, ADC_PORT)

00194 /* Normally you shouldn't need to change the below  lines  */
00195 /* global interrupt enable register name */
00196 #ifndef  GLOBAL_INT_REG
00197 #define  GLOBAL_INT_REG        SREG
00198 #endif
00199 /* global interrupt enable bit position */
00200 #ifndef  GLOBAL_INT_BIT
00201 #define  GLOBAL_INT_BIT        7
00202 #endif
00203 
00204 /* Convenience macros (we don't use them all) */
00205 #define  _BV(bit) (1 << (bit))
00206 #define  inb(sfr) _SFR_BYTE(sfr)
00207 #define  inw(sfr) _SFR_WORD(sfr)
00208 #define  outb(sfr, val) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) = (val))
00209 #define  outw(sfr, val) (_SFR_WORD(sfr) = (val))
00210 #define  cbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) &= ~_BV(bit))
00211 #define  sbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) |= _BV(bit))

00214 /*                                Global variables
00215 */
00216 /****************************************************************************/
00217 volatile union adcUnion
00218 {
00219   volatile uint16_t  adcInt;
00220   volatile uint8_t   adcByte[2];
00221 } adc;
00222 
00223 volatile uint8_t  adcDataValid;       /* mask of channels with valid data */
00224 volatile uint8_t  adcBusy = FALSE;    /* says "go away, I'm busy" */
00225 
00226 volatile uint16_t adcValue[NUMBER_OF_ADC_CHANNELS]; /* Result Array */
00227 volatile uint8_t  adcChannel;         /* Current Channel */
00228 uint8_t           adcMode;            /* Temporary mode variable */
00229 uint8_t           adcScanMask;        /* Temporary channel mask */
00230 uint8_t           temp;
00231 #if ADC_FREERUN_MODE == 1
00232 uint8_t           previousChannel;    /* Needed when free run converting */
00233 uint8_t           adcChannelMask;     /* value kept aside for refreshing */
00234 #endif
00235 
00236 #if ADC_DYNAMIC_CLOCK == 1
00237 uint8_t           adcPrescaler;       /* Prescaler setting for clock */
00238 #endif
00239 
00240 /*Local function prototypes */
00241 static void writeAdmux(uint8_t channel);
00242 
00243 /****************************************************************************/
00244 /*      Initialise the A/D converter
00245 
00246 This function forces the A/D converter to prepare for conversion from a reset
00247 state. Once it has been initialized, it can continue to be used for a series
00248 of conversions using the same clock rate and mode.
00249 
00250 ADC_DYNAMIC_CLOCK indicates whether the clock rate is defined in code or in a
00251 C macro. In the former case, it can be changed on the fly by the program if
00252 needed. Most of the time a fixed rate is adequate.
00253 
00254 Assumes that the ADC is not busy on a conversion. This should be tested first
00255 before calling this if changes to mode or rate are to be made on the fly.
00256 */
00257 
00258 uint8_t adcInit(uint8_t mode, uint16_t adcClock)
00259 {
00260   if (adcBusy) return FALSE;      /* Bomb out if not ready */
00261   adcMode = mode;                 /* Save this for other functions */
00262 
00263 /* Compute and set the ADC prescaler bits  */
00264 #if ADC_DYNAMIC_CLOCK == 1
00265   uint16_t cpuFrequency = F_CPU/1000;
00266   uint8_t adcDivisorTemp = cpuFrequency/adcClock;
00267   uint16_t adcDivisor = 256;
00268   adcPrescaler = 8;
00269   uint8_t x = 0;
00270   do
00271   {
00272     adcDivisor = adcDivisor/2;
00273     x = adcDivisorTemp/adcDivisor;
00274     adcPrescaler--;
00275   }
00276   while(x==0);
00277 /* Allow 20% maximum over the desired adc_clock else go to a higher
00278 adc_clock prescaler value */
00279   if((cpuFrequency/adcDivisor) >= ((adcClock*12)/10)) adcPrescaler++;
00280 #endif
00281 
00282 /* Make sure that all ADC work has ceased by forcing it off */
00283   outb(ADC_CONTROL_REG, 0);   /* Turns off ADEN - terminates conversions */
00284   sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, ADIF); /* force clear the interrupt flag */
00285 
00286 #if defined(PRR)
00287   cbi(PRR, PRADC);            /* Force out of ADC power reduction mode */
00288 #endif
00289 
00290 /* Enable the ADC and set the clock*/
00291 #if ADC_DYNAMIC_CLOCK == 1
00292   outb(ADC_CONTROL_REG, (_BV(ADEN) | adcPrescaler));
00293 #else
00294   outb(ADC_CONTROL_REG, (_BV(ADEN) | ADC_PRESCALER));
00295 #endif
00296 
00297 #if ADC_FREERUN_MODE == 1
00298 /* Enable free running mode */
00299   if(adcMode & FREERUN)
00300   {
00301     sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, AD_FREERUN );
00302 #if defined(AD_TRIGGER_REG)
00303     cbi(AD_TRIGGER_REG,ADTS0);
00304     cbi(AD_TRIGGER_REG,ADTS1);
00305     cbi(AD_TRIGGER_REG,ADTS2);
00306 #endif
00307   }
00308 #endif
00309 
00310 #if ADC_INTERRUPT_MODE == 1
00311 /* Enable interrupts */
00312   if(adcMode & INTERRUPT)
00313   {
00314     sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, ADIE);
00315     sei();
00316   }
00317 #endif
00318   return TRUE;
00319 }
00320 
00321 /****************************************************************************/
00322 /*        Activate an A/D conversion
00323 
00324 This function will initiate conversion of a group of channels defined by the
00325 channel mask. It makes use of parameters set by the adcInit function.
00326 All channels represented by the channelMask are scanned consecutively.
00327 The first conversion after initialization is slightly different to any later
00328 ones, as it takes about twice as long. The ADC must be idle otherwise it
00329 returns a NOT_READY indication.
00330 
00331 The ISR will take over the initiation of consecutive channel scans. The
00332 recommended action for free running mode is to change the channel in the ISR
00333 as it is guaranteed to have allowed sufficient time for the converter to
00334 read its configuration. However this will cause the channel to be changed for
00335 the NEXT conversion, so we need to keep track of this.
00336 
00337 Using sleep mode along with free running mode is problematical for this library
00338 and is not practicable, even though it is not prevented. Here it will only
00339 sleep for the first conversion which is discarded anyway.
00340 
00341 The adcInit function must be called first. No checks are made on this.
00342 */
00343 
00344 uint8_t adcStart(uint8_t channelMask)
00345 {
00346   if (adcBusy) return FALSE;      /* Bomb out if not ready */
00347   sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, ADIF);     /* Force clear the interrupt flag */
00348 
00349 /* Find the first channel to scan and set it. If none, bomb out.*/
00350   if (channelMask == 0) return FALSE;   /* Oops! - Nothing to do! */
00351   adcScanMask = channelMask;
00352   adcChannel = 0;
00353 /* Shift the adcScanMask until the first bit is a 1, to get the first channel
00354 to convert. Later we can check when it is finished when adcScanMask becomes
00355 zero. */
00356   while((adcScanMask & 1) == 0)
00357   {
00358     adcChannel++;
00359     adcScanMask >>= 1;
00360   }
00361   writeAdmux(adcChannel);         /* set the first channel */
00362   adcDataValid = 0;               /* mask of valid converted data */
00363 
00364 #if ADC_FREERUN_MODE == 1
00365   previousChannel = adcChannel;   /* we need this to manage freerun mode */
00366   adcChannelMask = channelMask;   /* keep aside for reloading */
00367 #endif
00368 
00369 #if (ADC_PORT_IS_BIDIRECTIONAL == 1)
00370 /* Set the relevant ADC channel ports to be inputs */
00371 /* Preserve the pin directions on all ADC port pins except those mentioned in
00372 the channel mask. Set those to inputs (0) */
00373   outb(ADC_PORT_DDR_REG, inb(ADC_PORT_DDR_REG) & ~channelMask);
00374 #endif
00375 
00376 /* Fire off the first conversion */
00377   sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, ADSC);
00378   adcBusy = TRUE;
00379 
00380 /* Setup the sleep mode. Different MCUs have the controls in different
00381 registers, and generally mixed up all over the place. ATMegax8 have an SMCR
00382 register specifically for sleeping and power control, while others put these in
00383 the MCUCR register. Note that all three SM bits must be written to define the
00384 ADC Noise Control mode, and we do these separately because they can occur in
00385 different orders in the register for different MCUs. As noted, sleep mode is
00386 ineffective unless only a single channel is scanned once only, so that we
00387 return here each time we want to do another scan.*/
00388 #if ADC_SLEEP_MODE == 1
00389   if(adcMode & SLEEP)
00390   {
00391 #if defined(SE)
00392 #if (ADC_SPECIFIC_SLEEP_MODE == 1)
00393     sbi(SLEEP_REG, SM0);
00394     cbi(SLEEP_REG, SM1);
00395     cbi(SLEEP_REG, SM2);
00396 #endif
00397     sbi(SLEEP_REG, SE);
00398 #endif
00399 /* Go to sleep. The ADC interrupt ISR will wake up the AVR */
00400     asm("sleep");
00401     asm("nop");
00402     asm("nop");
00403   }
00404 #endif
00405 
00406 return TRUE;
00407 }
00408 
00409 /****************************************************************************/
00410 /*      Read the result for a given channel
00411 
00412 Reads a result back from the A/D converter, returning -1 if the result is not
00413 ready. This function is non-blocking to allow mainline code to use an RTOS or
00414 other scheduling method.
00415 
00416 Blocking can be implemented simply by placing the call in a loop. On multiple
00417 channel scans it would be wise to poll each channel in the same order as the
00418 ISR uses, that is, lowest to highest. Be careful of free running mode as the
00419 first channel is scanned twice immediately after activation.
00420 
00421 The variable adcValid acts as a status indicator for the channel data. The ISR
00422 will set the bit corresponding to the specified channel when the data has been
00423 accessed (irregardless of whether the bit is already set), and the read
00424 function will clear it. This allows the ISR to signal the availability of the
00425 data, particularly during free running mode.
00426 */
00427 
00428 int adcRead(uint8_t channel)
00429 {
00430 #if ADC_INTERRUPT_MODE != 1
00431 /* For polled operation, we first check the completion flag to see if anything
00432 interesting has happened. Then just do what the ISR would have done. This
00433 section of the code is effectively independent of the actual channel data
00434 access that the function is purposed to do. We just take the opportunity here
00435 to update our results. */
00436   if (inb(ADC_CONTROL_REG) & _BV(ADIF)) > 0);
00437   {
00438     adc.adcByte[0]=inb(ADCL);   /* result from the hardware data registers */
00439     adc.adcByte[1]=inb(ADCH);
00440 #if ADC_FREERUN_MODE == 1
00441     if  (adcMode & FREERUN)
00442     {
00443 /* If the scan of all channels has finished, reload it for the next round */
00444       if (adcScanMask == 0) adcScanMask = adcChannelMask;
00445 /* Store result to the previous channel selection as the channel change made
00446 last time will not have taken effect for this cycle. */
00447       adcValue[previousChannel]=adc.adcValue;
00448       adcDataValid |= _BV(previousChannel); /* Set the valid data mask bit */
00449       previousChannel = adcChannel;         /* keep aside for next time */
00450     }
00451     else
00452 #endif
00453     {
00454       adcValue[adcChannel] = adc.adcInt;
00455       adcDataValid |= _BV(adcChannel);      /* Set the valid data mask bit */
00456     }
00457     adcScanMask >>= 1;                      /* shift out current channel bit */
00458     if (adcScanMask == 0) adcBusy = FALSE;  /* if none left, we are done */
00459     else 
00460     {
00461 /* Look for the next channel by shifting adcScanMask until the first bit is a
00462 1, to get the next channel in order. */
00463       while((adcScanMask & 1) == 0)
00464       {
00465         adcChannel++;
00466         adcScanMask >>= 1;
00467       }
00468       writeAdmux(adcChannel);               /* set it for the next scan */
00469 
00470 #if ADC_FREERUN_MODE != 1
00471       sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, ADSC);           /* Fire off next conversion */
00472 #endif
00473     }
00474   }
00475 #endif
00476   if ((adcDataValid & _BV(channel)) == 0) return -1;
00477   cli();                            /* make sure the ISR doesn't stuff us up */
00478   adcDataValid &= ~_BV(channel);    /* Clear the valid data mask bit */
00479   sei();
00480   return adcValue[channel];         /* and send back the result */
00481 }
00482 
00483 /****************************************************************************/
00484 /*            Interrupt Service Routine
00485 
00486 The ISR reads the result from the A/D converter and stores it in the
00487 appropriate result array location. A result flag bit is set to indicate what
00488 channels have been read and which are still to be completed. The next channel
00489 in a scan, if any, is selected and another conversion started.
00490 
00491 If freerun mode is active, then when a channel change is made, the conversion
00492 is already taking place and the change will not take effect until the next
00493 cycle. Therefore we must keep a record of the previous channel as the current
00494 conversion result will be for that channel, not the current one.
00495 
00496 The scan mask keeps a list of channels to be scanned. When a channel
00497 conversion is completed the mask is bit shifted to find the next channel. A
00498 flag is set for that channel in the adcDataValid byte. When the data is
00499 retrieved for the channel, that bit is reset. If data is not retrieved in
00500 time, it is overwritten by the next scan of the channel.
00501 */
00502 #if ADC_INTERRUPT_MODE == 1
00503 
00504 SIGNAL(SIG_ADC)
00505 {
00506 #if defined(SE)
00507   sbi(SLEEP_REG, SE);
00508 #endif
00509   sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, ADIF); /* Force clear the interrupt flag */
00510   adc.adcByte[0]=inb(ADCL);   /* result from the hardware data registers */
00511   adc.adcByte[1]=inb(ADCH);
00512 #if ADC_FREERUN_MODE == 1
00513   if  (adcMode & FREERUN)
00514   {
00515 /* If the scan of all channels has finished, reload it for the next round */
00516     if (adcScanMask == 0) adcScanMask = adcChannelMask;
00517 /* Store result to the previous channel selection as the channel change made
00518 last time will not have taken effect for this cycle. */
00519     adcValue[previousChannel]=adc.adcValue;
00520     adcDataValid |= _BV(previousChannel); /* Set the valid data mask bit */
00521     previousChannel = adcChannel;         /* keep aside for next time */
00522   }
00523   else
00524 #endif
00525   {
00526     adcValue[adcChannel] = adc.adcInt;    /* Get the result to the buffer */
00527     adcDataValid |= _BV(adcChannel);      /* Set the valid data mask bit */
00528   }
00529   adcScanMask >>= 1;                      /* shift out current channel bit */
00530   if (adcScanMask == 0) adcBusy = FALSE;  /* if none left, we are done */
00531   else 
00532   {
00533 /* Look for the next channel by shifting adcScanMask until the first bit is a
00534 1, to get the next channel in order. */
00535     adcChannel++;
00536     while((adcScanMask & 1) == 0)
00537     {
00538       adcChannel++;
00539       adcScanMask >>= 1;
00540     }
00541     writeAdmux(adcChannel);               /* set it for the next scan */
00542 
00543 #if ADC_FREERUN_MODE != 1
00544     sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, ADSC);           /* Fire off next conversion */
00545 #endif
00546   }
00547 }
00548 #endif
00549 
00550 /****************************************************************************/
00551 /*        Abort any conversions in progress
00552 */
00553 
00554 void abortConversion()
00555 {
00556   outb(ADC_CONTROL_REG, 0);   /* Turns off ADEN - terminates conversions */
00557   sbi(ADC_CONTROL_REG, ADIF); /* force clear the interrupt flag */
00558 }
00559 
00560 /****************************************************************************/
00561 /*        Write the current ADC channel to the Multiplexer register
00562 
00563 The other bits of the register are unchanged.
00564 */
00565 
00566 static void writeAdmux(uint8_t channel)
00567 {
00568   outb(ADC_MUX_REG, ((inb(ADC_MUX_REG) & 0xF8)|(channel & 0x07)));
00569 }
